title: The white cockade =
author: Grant, James
snippet: Rapidly they traversed the woods of Gosford, and saw on their left, the stars reflected in the Bay of Aberlady ; and erelong they spurred their horses harder to pass speedily the fragments of a ruined house, to which local superstition gave an evil name ; for there in the days of the Reformation,  dwelt a wicked Laird, who came into the world with both hands clenched, and with an entire set of teeth, from which John Knox, (the future Reformer) when baptising him at the font, predicted that he would be a cruel and bloody man.

title: The Diamond Rose: a life of love and duty.

title: The Diamond Rose: a life of love and duty.

snippet: I'm Lady Setoun now, better than the silly ladyat Aberlady, whose cracked lord's surely in theTower.

title: The Diamond Rose: a life of love and duty.
author: Tytler, Sarah
snippet: With muchdoubt and a little blame, the inflexible young judgedecided that Helen Lindesay would not sink intodespair because Katie Crichton had failed her, butthat she was fain to rest her tried, empty, yearningspirit on the rude yet delicate heart, so fearlessand so faithful, beneath the hodden gray in thegardens at Aberlady.

title: Tales of a Grandfather ... [ser. 1-3.] With notes.
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Meantime the greater part of the detachment designed for the descent uponLothian, being about sixteen hundred men, succeeded in their desperate attempt,and had landed at North Berwick, Aberlady, Gulan, and other places on thesouthern shores ofthe Frith, from whence they marched upon Haddington, wherethey again formed a junction, and refreshed themselves for anight, till they shouldlearn the fate of their friends who had not yet appeared.

title: Tours in Scotland 1677 & 1681. By T. Kirk and R. Thoresby. Edited by P. Hume Brown
author: Kirk, Thomas
snippet: Thence to Aberlady, to Preston Pans, a very long town ;thence to Musselborough, where alighted, to see my LordTwadall's house;1 the gardens are in good order, the houseis unfurnished, but the rooms have good roofs, some painted,some plastered.
